subject: Re: AW: AW: [junit] get Message "Could not invoke the suite()  method" fr om JUnit Testrunner
msgSnippet: Some general comments. 1. There is never ever a reason to call new String( literal string ). Ever. Please replace those calls with just literal string . 2.
messageBody:
Some general comments.

1. There is never ever a reason to call new String("literal string"). Ever. Please replace those calls with just "literal string".
2. Make the indentation of this code consistent, please. I cannot even begin to read it.
3. Don't use the method name "test". It doesn't mean anything and could confuse the TestRunner.

I just don't understand at all what your suite() method is trying to do. It seems to add some number of copies of the same test method to the suite, which looks to me to do nothing more than repeat the same test over and over again.

I guess that the suite() method throws a runtime exception when it executes. Given how complex it is, there is no way for me to understand what it's trying to do.

What is it that you're trying to do here? I am thoroughly confused.

So said Weber, Wolfgang on 3/9/2003 --------------------
Hi Jason (and all the others)!

Second try for the code. You can download it from the Files-Section inside the group. Its name is sources.zip, subtitled with "couldn't invoke the suite()-method()". I hope you can find it:--))

I've checked the directory you asked me to do, but there was no jar-File.

What kind of JDK VAG uses I don't really know, outside VAJ I use SUN's JKD, hope that helps...:--)))

Bye




--
Wolfgang Weber mailto:Wolfgang.Weber@...
sd&m AG http://www.sdm.de
software design & management

-----Ursprüngliche Nachricht-----
Von: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...]
Gesendet: Donnerstag, 6. März 2003 13:57
An: junit@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: Re: AW: [junit] get Message "Could not invoke the suite() method" fr om JUnit Testrunner


Wolfgang,

First, I saw no code. If you attached it as a file, it is probably being stripped. You have two choices here, inline the code with the message or put it in the 'Files' section of this group and let us know where it is.

Now on to the point of the message:

Curious. This is totally different behavior, as you can see. Here the suite was invoked. I see nothing in the trace to lead me to a conclusion though. However, about your classpath -- look in your <jdk-install-directory>/lib/ext. Is there a crimson.jar, xerces.jar, or xercesImpl.jar? If so, you will need to purge them. The JDK 1.3 automatically takes anything in the lib/ext directory and prepends it to your classpath.

Also, I assume you are using SUN's JDK. Is that so?

One other note, if you compile with debugging information you will get the line number in the stack trace.

=jason

On Wed, 2003-03-05 at 14:09, Weber, Wolfgang wrote: Hi Jason (and all the others)!

I followed your suggestion to use the textuirunner instead of the swinguirunner. Look what I got:

C:\>java -cp JUnit.jar;xercesImpl.jar;xmlParserAPIs.jar;testtreiberNom.jar teste xercise.Testtreiber Es wurden 3 Testfaelle eingelesen!

..F
Time: 1,993
There was 1 failure:
1) test(testexercise.Testtreiber) junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:32)
at junit.framework.Assert.assert(Assert.java:19)
at junit.framework.Assert.assert(Assert.java:26)
at testexercise.Testtreiber.aufruf(Testtreiber.java)
at testexercise.Testtreiber.test(Testtreiber.java)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:156)
at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:130)
at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:121)
at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:157)
at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:152)
at junit.textui.TestRunner.doRun(TestRunner.java:74)
at junit.textui.TestRunner.run(TestRunner.java:201)
at junit.textui.TestRunner.run(TestRunner.java:187)
at testexercise.Testtreiber.main(Testtreiber.java)

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0

This means that the classpath is right. What's wrong so far is the number of runs, Junit reported: 1.

Using the code inside VAJ, there are 3 runs and that what the line "Es wurden 3 Testfaelle eingelesen!" means: 3 testcases. But Junit stopped after the first Assert.fail.

Somebody asked for the code. Here we are. I hope you can find the problem. Thank you very much for your support.

Bye
